citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, one of the adult female Bengal cats (microchip #: 985141005230595) that the licensee removed
from the breeding colony and made a personal pet, did not have a disposition record. Failure to properly complete
disposition records can hinder traceability and accounting of covered animals. Each dealer shall make, keep, and
maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the information under this section concerning each cat
purchased or otherwise acquired, owned held, or otherwise in his/her possession or under his/her control, or which is
transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer, including any offspring born of any animal while in
his/her possession or under his/her control. Furthermore, each dealer shall use Records of Disposition of Dogs and Cats
(APHIS Form 7006) to make, keep, and maintain the information required by paragraph (a)(1) of this section.
Correct by: 20 June 2023

The two white wire cages housing multiple Bengal kittens had inadequate floor space for the number of weaned kittens
housed. A white wire cage by the front living room window housing 6 Bengal kittens measured 25.5 inches by 47 inches,
which is equal to 8.3 ft2 in total floor space, not excluding water and food dishes present in the cage. A white wire cage by
the kitchen housing 4 Bengal kittens measured 22 inches by 38.5 inches, which is equal to 5.8 ft2 in total floor space, not
excluding water and food dishes present in the cage. To meet minimum regulatory floor space requirements, a single
enclosure housing 6 weaned kittens should be at least 18 ft2, excluding food and water dishes. And for an enclosure to
house 4 weaned kittens, minimum floor space should be 12 ft2, excluding food and water dishes. Insufficient floor space
for growing weaned kittens can result in their poor health and welfare. Dealers must provide the required minimum floor
space of 3 ft2 for each adult cat and weaned kitten housed in primary enclosures.
Correct by: 23 June 2023

At the time of inspection there was a white wire cage near the window in the living room housing six weaned Bengal
kittens where the solitary resting surface was not large enough to simultaneously hold all occupants within the enclosure.
Failure to provide an elevated resting surface that all enclosed cats can simultaneously occupy, can negatively impact
their well-being by interfering with species typical behaviors such as socialization and keeping warm. Each primary
enclosure housing cats must contain a resting surface or surfaces that, in the aggregate, are large enough to hold all the
occupants of the primary enclosure at the same time comfortably.
Correct by: 23 June 2023

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, the licensee stated there was no active pest control program in place. During the inspection,
multiple black flies and smaller flying insects were present in various areas that the animals were housed. The presence
of pests such as flies in areas where animals are kept can spread infectious diseases and contribute to insanitary
conditions. Dealers must have a safe and effective program established and maintained for the control of insects and
pests.
Correct by: 23 June 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
Madeline Anna, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER
BRENTON COX, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n
